title: Requirements
section: 2 02 Awareness of how specimens are being used
text:
2 02 Awareness of how specimens are being used
Provide metrics that indicate usage of a specimen.
Requires that specimen access events are logged and retrievable.
Usage metrics should include derived products as well, and so it is necessary to locate related content and usage metrics associated with the related content.

title: Requirements
section: 3 03 Availability of all information related to a sample
text:
3 03 Availability of all information related to a sample
A sample has related content. All relations (transitive) need to be discoverable in the view of a sample. There are different types of relations. For example an image may be associated with a sample through a relationship that is different to the relationship between a sample and derived products. In an RDF view, the type of relation is the predicate of the association between a sample (subject) and the related item (object). Relationships occur within a context and there may be multiple contexts associated with any content.

title: Requirements
section: 4 04 Define relationships between things such as samples and derived products
text:
4 04 Define relationships between things such as samples and derived products
Guidelines and mechanisms to support the creation of relationships between things such as samples, images of samples, components of other projects (e.g. Field Notes project of Smithsonian), derived products, annotations.
Instrument calibration records associated with an analysis.
Q. Should relationships include actions like loaning a sample? This seems more like a provenance topic, though provenance can be expressed as relations…

title: Requirements
text:
5 05 Support sample management (loans, duplicates, subsamples)
Guidelines and mechanisms to support tracking of samples on loan or moved to a new institution. Allow for duplicate samples in different organizations, as is common in botany. For samples that can be sub-samples, track the subsamples and the status (i.e. amount remaining) of the parent sample.
Note that the process of sample loaning, moving, or other disposition is an operation of the collection. iSamples should support the tracking and discovery of samples that may be on loan or moved.

title: Requirements
section: 7 07 Services support content negotiation, alternate renderings
text:
7 07 Services support content negotiation, alternate renderings
Different renderings of the same content are needed for different purposes. A human should see a different rendering of metadata than a piece of software. Note that the rendering may be performed client side using a programmatic expression of the metadata. For example, a web UI may consume the same JSON to render in HTML that is also used by software.

title: Requirements
section: 8 08 Recognize that any entity may have multiple identifiers, some of which may not be globally unique.
text:
8 08 Recognize that any entity may have multiple identifiers, some of which may not be globally unique.
There are many examples of different types of identifiers attached to content. Some identifiers may be well formed (globally unique and resolvable) others may be more context specific. Context specific identifiers should include sufficient information to determine the context.
Ad-hoc identifiers created in the field can be an example of context specific identifiers. For example, a field investigator may simply label items 1, 2, 3, … Those identifiers are only useful when the context of their creation is known and available.
Globally unique identifiers may take many different forms (e.g. DOI, ARK, IGSN, …), there may be multiple GUIDs for content.
Identifiers may be used at different levels of aggregation.
Inappropriate use of identifiers (e.g. ROR for samples) should be discouraged or blocked.

title: Requirements
section: 9 09 Content must be programmatically accessible and transferable to different systems
text:
9 09 Content must be programmatically accessible and transferable to different systems
All content should be accessible through API and should exhibit no loss of information in the transfer to another system.
Note that it is expected that collections of content will be large (>> 10E6 items) so efficient paging, windowing and other subset selection mechanisms are needed.
The web publishing pattern (i.e. robots.txt -> sitemap -> schema.org) should be available for all resources appropriate for broad discovery.
See also Services support content negotiation, alternate renderings

10 10 User Interfaces for discovery and display of information should be efficient and practical for research use and expose relationships between items as appropriate.
At the global scale, low resolution maps, timescales and general discovery mechanisms are useful. As specificity increases, opportunities for expressing relationships between content as a means of assisting discovery and interpretation can follow.

title: Requirements
section: 11 11 The diversity of metadata standards in use should be supported whilst also encouraging consistency in use and possibly reducing the diversity as appropriate with no loss of meaning.
text:
11 11 The diversity of metadata standards in use should be supported whilst also encouraging consistency in use and possibly reducing the diversity as appropriate with no loss of meaning.
There are many metadata formats in use, and this will continue. Creation of new metadata formats should be discouraged by facilitating concept matching to existing metadata elements. 
Mixed authority metadata formats should be supported. E.g. a metadata document may contain concepts defined in Dublin Core, ISO-19115, and the Observation Data Model
Vocabulary reuse should be encouraged.
Standard vocabularies for common concepts should be readily available (e.g. missing values, types of samples).
Recognize that there are natural levels of aggregation for metadata describing different things. For example individuals, groups, organizations.

title: Requirements
section: 12 12 Ingest and deliver meta/data in multiple open formats
text:
12 12 Ingest and deliver meta/data in multiple open formats
Portals  may choose what formats they will allow for data upload and ingest and what format they want to use to deliver data. iSB shouldmust support the use of common open formats such as CSV, JSON, possibly XML and XLSX. 
iSC will receive data only from iSB instances and project personnel, so it can limit the number of input formats. Metadata delivered as a result of searching the iSC index should be delivered in one or a few open formats.
Note that translation between serialization formats may result in loss of information. Support of multiple serializations can significantly increase implementation overhead.

title: Requirements
section: 14 14 Web interfaces should be flexible and loosely coupled through standard APIs to encourage diverse adoption
text:
14 14 Web interfaces should be flexible and loosely coupled through standard APIs to encourage diverse adoption
Portal web interfaces can serve a variety of audiences. In some cases (e.g. iSC) the interface will serve a very broad, diverse community. Other instances may be very specific (e.g. iSB or web UI serving the needs of a specific project). 
UIs should leverage standard APIs as far as possible, and underlying infrastructure should similarly express APIs using standard mechanisms.
REST, GraphQL are common API standards that should be leveraged. Other more specific interfaces such as the various Open Geospatial Consortium standards, and HDF should be utilized in preference to custom APIs.

## 16 Data and metadata to be stored by iSamples in a box.
SESAR would like to utilize iSB as a data repository.
Also recognize that data and metadata may be stored on separate systems, and so reliable linking (e.g. via identifier) is necessary. Such indirect reference should be at least context aware (with context as part of metadata) or globally resolvable.
Note: the data may be large and so all data may not be stored on iSC. Q. How to determine boundaries of what is replicated? Metadata will be copied to iSC.

title: Requirements
section: 16 17 Content may not all be publicly accessible.
text:
16 17 Content may not all be publicly accessible.
There may be content (metadata, data, related content) with information that should not be publicly accessible (e.g. artifact location). This implies that the system should either reject access controlled content or implement access control at all levels.
Implementation of access control all or nothing. It must be integrated at all levels and rigorous. A break in trust can have significant consequences beyond the project.
Leverage existing user management infrastructure as far as possible. ORCID for user identification, oauth + JWT for access
Group management should be delegated to another system if possible. TODO: suggestions for infrastructure? Enable arbitrary group creation, management. Roles.

title: Requirements
section: 17 18 Validation rules can assist with production of higher quality content.
text:
17 18 Validation rules can assist with production of higher quality content. 
Just like a spell checker, validation rules can assist with production of higher quality content. Validation rules should be sharable and reusable. Content entry / editing systems should leverage validation mechanisms for immediate user feedback and/or guidance.
Note that validation is context dependent, and the validity rules may change over time.

title: Overview
text:
Physical samples are represented by a digital record.
Each digital record is addressable by at least one identifier that is unique to the record.
A collection of digital records can be represented by a list of the record identifiers.
A list of all physical sample digital record identifiers (global record list) can be constructed from the collection lists.
Digital records may be presented in different serializations (media type).
Digital records of a serialization may present different views of the same information (profile).
iSamples has defined a profile applicable to all physical samples.
iSamples has defined a programmatic interface
PlantUML diagram removed for testing [SMR 2024-01-04]

title: 1 Namespaces defined by iSamples
text:
Namespaces are used to uniquely address resources offered by the project.
In order to support introspection, all namespace IRIs are to be resolvable. Resolution involves three variables: the IRI, the requested content type, and an optional profile.
The IRI provides the location of the resource. Reference to specific items within a resource can be made in two ways: by path (e.g. /resource/element) and by fragment (e.g. resource#element). IRI fragments are not transmitted to a server by a client, hence a fragment identifier is always relative to the retrieved document. The basic rule is thus, the path element reference is used to reference a specific document, then a fragment is used to reference a specific component of the document.
The requested content type is presented by a client in the Accept header. If no Accept header is presented by the client or the Accept header is ambiguous (e.g. */*), then the default content type is returned. If a specific content type can not be matched, then a 406 Not Acceptable status is returned.



IRI

https://w3id.org/isamples/


The namespace base provides the root for project IRIs. The project will utilize the w3id.org infrastructure to enable abstraction of the advertised location and the physical location of the resource. Such abstraction is especially important early in the project as locations of resources are in flux.



The default format for definitions is JSON-LD. Other formats may be requested using the Accept header.

IRI

iss: <https://w3id.org/isamples/models/>


Definitions include static content such as vocabularies, ontologies, schemas, and other documents providing machine and human actionable documents describing resources.

title: Sampled Feature Type vocabulary
text:
Vocabularies and extensions:
History:
2021-12-10 SMR add missing skos:inScheme statements  2022-01-07 SMR change to https://w3id.org/isample/ uri base, make the ConceptScheme an ontology as well. For uploading to ESIP COR and w3id resolution redirect set up. Add some mappings to other ontologies using seeAlso, closeMatch, narrowMatch.  2022-03-11 SMR change definitions from rdfs:comment to skos:definition. Minor fixes in definitions. Add skos matches to URIs from other vocabularies. Fix typo in glacierenvrionment URI (changed the URI to glacierenvironment)  2022-09-07 SMR update some of the skos mappings to other vocabularies; remove references to other vocabularies as NamedIndividual. Remove rocksample class, it was not linked in hierarchy and inconsistent with design.  2022-09-30 add biological entity as sampled feature, per issue https://github.com/isamplesorg/metadata/issues/107. This update was lost at some point and added back in 2022-12-09.  2023-11-05 SMR update version to 1.0, prep for release  Remove Marine biome, Subaerial terrestrial environment, Subaqueous terrestrial environment per github issue https://github.com/isamplesorg/metadata/issues/41. Make Experiment setting and Laboratory or curatorial environemtn subclasses of Active human occupation site.
Concept Hierarchy:

title: Sampled Feature Type vocabulary
text:
1 Any sampled feature

The concept Any sampled feature  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/anysampledfeature  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Anthropogenic environment, Biological entity, Earth environment, Extraterrestrial environment
Definition:
Any thing that can be sampled. Top concept in sampled feature type vocabulary.

1.1 Anthropogenic environment

The concept Anthropogenic environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/anthropogenicenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Anthropogenic environment
Immediately narrower concepts:
Active human occupation site, Site of past human activities
Definition:
Sampled feature is produced by or related to human activity past or present.

1.1.1 Active human occupation site

The concept Active human occupation site  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/activehumanoccupationsite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Anthropogenic environment->Active human occupation site
Immediately narrower concepts:
Experiment setting, Laboratory or curatorial environment
Definition:
Specimen samples materials or objects produced by current or ongoing human activity

1.1.1.1 Experiment setting

The concept Experiment setting  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/experimentsetting  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Anthropogenic environment->Active human occupation site->Experiment setting
Definition:
Sampled feature is the experimental set up that produced the sample.


1.1.1.2 Laboratory or curatorial environment

The concept Laboratory or curatorial environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/laboratorycuratorialenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Anthropogenic environment->Active human occupation site->Laboratory or curatorial environment
Definition:
Specimen samples environment in a laboratory; e.g. lab blank measurements.



1.1.2 Site of past human activities

The concept Site of past human activities  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/pasthumanoccupationsite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Anthropogenic environment->Site of past human activities
Definition:
specimen samples a place where humans have been and left evidence of their activity. Includes prehistoric and paleo hominid sites



1.2 Biological entity

The concept Biological entity  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/biologicalentity  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Biological entity
Definition:
Sampled feature is an organism. Use for samples that represent some species of organism as the proximate sampled feature for which the focus is not the environment that the organism inhabits.


1.3 Earth environment

The concept Earth environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/earthenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment
Immediately narrower concepts:
Atmosphere, Earth interior, Earth surface, Glacier environment, Subsurface fluid reservoir, Water body
Definition:
specimen samples the natural Earth environment

1.3.1 Atmosphere

The concept Atmosphere  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/atmosphere  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Atmosphere
Definition:
specimen samples the Earth’s atmosphere


1.3.2 Earth interior

The concept Earth interior  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/earthinterior  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Earth interior
Definition:
Specimen samples solid material within the earth


1.3.3 Earth surface

The concept Earth surface  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/earthsurface  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Earth surface
Immediately narrower concepts:
Lake river or stream bottom, Marine water body bottom, Subaerial surface environment
Definition:
Specimen samples the interface between solid earth and hydrosphere or atmosphere. Includes samples representing things collected on the surface, or in the uppermost part of the material below the surface. Not including recently deposited sediment that has not been modified by interaction with the surface environment.

1.3.3.1 Lake river or stream bottom

The concept Lake river or stream bottom  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/lakeriverstreambottom  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Earth surface->Lake river or stream bottom
Definition:
Specimen samples the solid Earth interface with a lake or flowing water body


1.3.3.2 Marine water body bottom

The concept Marine water body bottom  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/marinewaterbodybottom  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Earth surface->Marine water body bottom
Definition:
Specimen samples the solid Earth interface with marine or brackish water body. Includes benthic boundary layer: the bottom layer of water and the uppermost layer of sediment directly influenced by the overlying water


1.3.3.3 Subaerial surface environment

The concept Subaerial surface environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/subaerialsurfaceenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Earth surface->Subaerial surface environment
Definition:
Specimen samples the interface between solid Earth and atmosphere. Sample is collected on the surface, or immediately below surface (zone of bioturbation). Include soil and recently deposited subaerial sediment at the surface.



1.3.4 Glacier environment

The concept Glacier environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/glacierenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Glacier environment
Definition:
Sample of ice, water, or other thing from a glacier, ice sheet, ice shelf, iceberg. Does not include various environments adjacent to glacier.


1.3.5 Subsurface fluid reservoir

The concept Subsurface fluid reservoir  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/subsurfacefluidreservoir  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Subsurface fluid reservoir
Definition:
Specimen samples fluid that resides in fractures or intergranular porosity in the solid earth.


1.3.6 Water body

The concept Water body  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/waterbody  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Water body
Immediately narrower concepts:
Marine environment, Terrestrial water body
Definition:
Specimen samples the hydrosphere

1.3.6.1 Marine environment

The concept Marine environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/marinewaterbody  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Water body->Marine environment
Definition:
specimen samples marine hydrosphere


1.3.6.2 Terrestrial water body

The concept Terrestrial water body  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/terrestrialwaterbody  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Earth environment->Water body->Terrestrial water body
Definition:
Specimen samples terrestrial hydrosphere– lake, other standing water, or a flowing water body (river, stream..) Include saline water in terrestrial evaporite environments.




1.4 Extraterrestrial environment

The concept Extraterrestrial environment  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/extraterrestrialenvironment  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/sampledfeature/1.0/sampledfeaturevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Any sampled feature->Extraterrestrial environment
Definition:
specimen samples environment outside of solid earth, hydrosphere, or atmosphere.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Sampled feature role
text:
Vocabularies and extensions:
History:
2023-11-17 SMR generate to account for sample classifications in SESAR
Concept Hierarchy:

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Sampled feature role
text:
1 Sampled feature part

The concept Sampled feature part  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sampledfeaturepart  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
inclusion, individual constituent, rock body
Definition:
A sampled feature that is part of a larger sampled feature; Could be improper part (e.g. the whole larger feature)

1.1 inclusion

The concept inclusion  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/inclusion  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion
Immediately narrower concepts:
clast, cognate inclusion, fluid inclusion, melt inclusion, mineral inclusion, xenolith
Definition:
sampled feature is an object contained within a larger body of material.

1.1.1 clast

The concept clast  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/clast  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->clast
Definition:
A clast is a fragment of rock or mineral derived from some pre-existing rock or generated by intrabasinal processes that is a part of a sediment


1.1.2 cognate inclusion

The concept cognate inclusion  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/cognateinclusion  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->cognate inclusion
Definition:
An inclusion in an igneous rock that is interpreted to be genetically related to the enclosing rock.
Alternate labels:
autolith


1.1.3 fluid inclusion

The concept fluid inclusion  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/fluidinclusion  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->fluid inclusion
Definition:
an inclusion that is an opening in a mineral grain containing fluid (liquid or gas).


1.1.4 melt inclusion

The concept melt inclusion  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/meltinclusion  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->melt inclusion
Definition:
An inclusion in a mineral grain in an igneous rock that is interpreted to consist of trapped magma from which the igneous rock was formed.


1.1.5 mineral inclusion

The concept mineral inclusion  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/mineralinclusion  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->mineral inclusion
Definition:
An inclusion of a mineral phase contained inside a grain of another mineral.


1.1.6 xenolith

The concept xenolith  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/xenolith  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->inclusion->xenolith
Definition:
An inclusion that is a fragment of pre-existing material that is contained in an igneous rock and unrelated to the magma that formed the rock.



1.2 individual constituent

The concept individual constituent  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/individualconstituent  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->individual constituent
Immediately narrower concepts:
cement, groundmass, phenocryst, porphyroblast
Definition:
sampled feature is a single particle or collection of particles that share some characteristic, within or extracted from a larger sample.

1.2.1 cement

The concept cement  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/cement  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->individual constituent->cement
Definition:
sampled feature is material that binds constituent particles together in a sedimentary rock.


1.2.2 groundmass

The concept groundmass  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/groundmass  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->individual constituent->groundmass
Definition:
sampled feature is fine-grained to aphanitic material that is interstitial to larger crystals or particles in a sample.


1.2.3 phenocryst

The concept phenocryst  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/phenocryst  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->individual constituent->phenocryst
Definition:
Sampled feature is a crystal that is significantly larger than surrounding crystals in an igneous rock.


1.2.4 porphyroblast

The concept porphyroblast  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/porphyroblast  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->individual constituent->porphyroblast
Definition:
Sampled feature is a crystal that is significantly larger than surrounding crystals in a metamorphic rock.



1.3 rock body

The concept rock body  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/rockbody  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/essampledfeatrole/1.0/sfrolevocabulary
Path from the top concept:  Sampled feature part->rock body
Definition:
sampled feature is representative of a rock body, i.e. it represents the whole of the sampled body.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
Vocabularies and extensions:
History:
2023-07-07 SMR add solid material sample and broader relations from classes it subsumes.  2023-07-27 SMR modify base specimen type vocabulary, add ‘Non biologic solid object’ to replace ‘solid material sample’, change broader relations in this vocab to use that as parent class where appropriate. ‘Solid material sample’ is too closely linked to material type, created confusion. Intention is a specimen category for solid objects that are not biologic. Obviously there is some overlap with Research specimens.
Concept Hierarchy:

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
1 Analytical preparation

The concept Analytical preparation  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/analyticalpreparation  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Cell culture, Dissolved chemical fraction, FIB lamella, Glass slide smear, Individual solid cube, Magnetic fraction, Mechanical fraction, Mineral separate, Sectioned specimen, Non-magnetic fraction, Peel, Prepared powder, Pressed pellet, Residual material, Slab
Definition:
Specimen is a product of processing required for some observation procedure, e.g. thin section, XRF bead, SEM stub, rock powder. If identified separately, this should have a ‘parent’ link to the original sample

1.1 Cell culture

The concept Cell culture  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/cellculture  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Bundle biome aggregation->Analytical preparation->Cell culture
Definition:
a collection of cells are grown under controlled conditions, generally outside of their natural environment


1.2 Dissolved chemical fraction

The concept Dissolved chemical fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/dissolvedchemicalfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Analytical preparation->Dissolved chemical fraction
Immediately narrower concepts:
Eluate
Definition:
A fluid concentrating some constituent of interest from a parent sample. The dissolved constituent is actually the sample material of interest.

1.2.1 Eluate

The concept Eluate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/eluate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Analytical preparation->Dissolved chemical fraction->Eluate
Definition:
The fluid product that contains the analyte of interest washed from a chromatography column



1.3 FIB lamella

The concept FIB lamella  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/fiblamella  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->FIB lamella
Definition:
very thin sheet of solid material milled from a larger sample using a focused ion beam. Used for TEM analysis.


1.4 Glass slide smear

The concept Glass slide smear  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/glassslidesmear  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Other solid Object->Analytical preparation->Glass slide smear
Definition:
sample from a cell culture (or other microparticulate suspension) spread into a thin layer on a glass slide for optical investigation


1.5 Individual solid cube

The concept Individual solid cube  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/individualsolidcube  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Individual solid cube
Definition:
A sample that is a prepared cube of material, intended as a sample of that material.


1.6 Magnetic fraction

The concept Magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/magneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Magnetic fraction
Definition:
a collection of particles separated from a crushed rock sample based on their attraction to a magnet.


1.7 Mechanical fraction

The concept Mechanical fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mechanicalfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mechanical fraction
Definition:
defined by sample preparation involving mechanical processing, e.g. grain size, density, or grain shape separation.


1.8 Mineral separate

The concept Mineral separate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mineralseparate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate
Immediately narrower concepts:
Magnetic fraction, Non-magnetic fraction
Definition:
an aggregation of particles of the same mineral extracted and concentrated from a rock.

1.8.1 Magnetic fraction

The concept Magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/magneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Magnetic fraction
Definition:
a collection of particles separated from a crushed rock sample based on their attraction to a magnet.


1.8.2 Non-magnetic fraction

The concept Non-magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/nonmagneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Non-magnetic fraction
Definition:
collection of particles from a crushed rock sample based on their lack of attraction to a magnet



1.9 Sectioned specimen

The concept Sectioned specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mountedsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen
Immediately narrower concepts:
Thick section, Thin section, Ultra thin section
Definition:
a thin slice of a solid material that has been mounted on a glass slide for study

1.9.1 Thick section

The concept Thick section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/thicksection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thick section
Definition:
Thick sections are like thin sections, but milled to a greater thickness. Typcially polished on one or both sides and used for fluid or melt inclusion studies, Raman analyses, and infrared spectroscopy analyses, and SEM or electron microprobe. The standard thickness for a fluid inclusion thick section is 50 micrometers, but thick sections can be made at any thickness. Thick sections can be attached to a glass slide, or can be prepared so that they can be removed from their mount as a stand-alone slice of rock.


1.9.2 Thin section

The concept Thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/thinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thin section
Immediately narrower concepts:
Polished thin section
Definition:
thin sliver of rock cut from a sample with a diamond saw and ground optically flat, and then mounted on a glass slide and ground smooth using progressively finer abrasive grit until the sample is 30 microns thick.

1.9.2.1 Polished thin section

The concept Polished thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/polishedthinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thin section->Polished thin section
Definition:
a thin section that has its free surface polished until perfectly planar and free of pits and scratches. Used for reflected light petrography and for electron microprobe or SEM investigation.



1.9.3 Ultra thin section

The concept Ultra thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/ultrathinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Ultra thin section
Definition:
An ordinary thin section that is attached to the glass slide using a soluble cement such as Canada balsam (soluble in ethanol) to allow both sides to be worked on. The section is polished on both sides using a fine diamond paste until it has a thickness in the range of 2-12 microns. This technique has been used to study the microstructure of very fine-grained carbonate rocks, and also in the preparation of mineral and rock specimens for transmission electron microscopy.



1.10 Non-magnetic fraction

The concept Non-magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/nonmagneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Non-magnetic fraction
Definition:
collection of particles from a crushed rock sample based on their lack of attraction to a magnet


1.11 Peel

The concept Peel  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/peel  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Other solid Object->Analytical preparation->Peel
Definition:
Acetate peels are made by polishing a planar surface on a sample, etching it with acid to give it some relief, and then chemically melting a piece of acetate onto that surface. The acetate is then pulled off for examination under a microscope. The acetate preserves a fingerprint of the internal structure of the sample surface. Used in paleontology to study complex fossils, e.g. bryozoan.


1.12 Prepared powder

The concept Prepared powder  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/preparedpowder  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Prepared powder
Immediately narrower concepts:
Prepared rock powder
Definition:
distinguish from particulate in that particulate is sampled as a micron-size aggregate, whereas this material is ground to a powder for subsequent analysis; it is a powder as a function of some preparation process (e.g. chemical precipitation)
Alternate labels:
Powder

1.12.1 Prepared rock powder

The concept Prepared rock powder  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/preparedrockpowder  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Prepared powder->Prepared rock powder
Definition:
a powder manufactured by pulverizing a rock.



1.13 Pressed pellet

The concept Pressed pellet  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/pressedpellet  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Pressed pellet
Definition:
a sample prepared by grinding a parent sample to a fine powder, mixing it with a binder, and pressing the mixture into a die at a pressure of between 15 and 35 tons to produce a solid disc for subsequent analysis, typically by X-Ray fluorescence.


1.14 Residual material

The concept Residual material  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/residualmaterial  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->Residual material
Definition:
Sample is material remaining after processing to extract some other components of interest from the sample.
Alternate labels:
Residue


1.15 Slab

The concept Slab  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/slab  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Slab
Definition:
a relatively planar rock sample,cut from a large sample to produce a tabular peice of rock with the irregular outline of the original sample on the diameter where the cut was mate.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
2 Bundle biome aggregation

The concept Bundle biome aggregation  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/bundlebiomeaggregation  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Cell culture
Definition:
An aggregation of whole organisms representative of some biome

2.1 Cell culture

The concept Cell culture  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/cellculture  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Bundle biome aggregation->Analytical preparation->Cell culture
Definition:
a collection of cells are grown under controlled conditions, generally outside of their natural environment

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
3 Fluid in container

The concept Fluid in container  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/fluidincontainer  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Direct fluid sample, Dissolved chemical fraction, Processed fluid sample
Definition:
Specimen is a container whose contents are liquid, gas, or mixed dominantly fluid phases that is the actual sample material. Fluid might include minor solid particles. Container typically human made, but also includes natural fluid container, e.g. fluid inclusion in a mineral grain. Includes colloids, foams, gels, suspensions. The sample is the fluid substance; fluid samples collected to analyze the contained biome should be considered ‘Biome Aggregation’

3.1 Direct fluid sample

The concept Direct fluid sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/directfluidsample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Direct fluid sample
Definition:
a fluid collected from the sampled feature (e.g. water body, hydrothermal vent, atmosphere…) with no processing. (e.g. filtration, addition of preservatives).


3.2 Dissolved chemical fraction

The concept Dissolved chemical fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/dissolvedchemicalfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Analytical preparation->Dissolved chemical fraction
Immediately narrower concepts:
Eluate
Definition:
A fluid concentrating some constituent of interest from a parent sample. The dissolved constituent is actually the sample material of interest.

3.2.1 Eluate

The concept Eluate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/eluate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Analytical preparation->Dissolved chemical fraction->Eluate
Definition:
The fluid product that contains the analyte of interest washed from a chromatography column



3.3 Processed fluid sample

The concept Processed fluid sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/processedfluidsample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Processed fluid sample
Immediately narrower concepts:
Filtrate
Definition:
fluid sample that has been processed in some way during or after collection, e.g. by filtering, addition of preservatives.

3.3.1 Filtrate

The concept Filtrate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/filtrate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Fluid in container->Processed fluid sample->Filtrate
Definition:
A sample that has gone through a filtration process to separate solids from fluids (liquids or gases), using a filter medium through which only the fluid can pass. Must be associated with a filter size.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
4 genericAggregation

The concept genericAggregation  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/genericaggregation  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Boxed core, Composite sample, Core Catcher, Cuttings, Dredge, Material Captured in Filter, Mechanical fraction, Mineral separate, Natural aggregate specimen, Prepared powder, Trawl, TEM grod
Definition:
An aggregate specimen that is not biogenic or composed of anthropogenic material fragments. Examples: loose soil or sediment (e.g. in a bag), rock chips, particulate filtrate or precipitate; rock powders.

4.1 Boxed core

The concept Boxed core  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/boxedcore  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Boxed core
Definition:
A collection of core peices that are stored in an individual box. Typically the box will contain core peices from the same core.


4.2 Composite sample

The concept Composite sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/compositesample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Composite sample
Immediately narrower concepts:
Chip Channel Sample, High Grade Sample, Site composite sample
Definition:
a sample composed of multiple peices, representative of some material, or representative of some site. The peices do not all originate from the same object.

4.2.1 Chip Channel Sample

The concept Chip Channel Sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/chipchannelsample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Composite sample->Chip Channel Sample
Definition:
small chips of rock collected over a specified interval, with the objective to obtain a representative sample for that interval. Most of the time chip channel samples are collected in succession along a sample line which is laid out in advance using a tape. The freshest material possible is sampled, preferably chipping directly from bedrock. Sample intervals are set at a specified width, usually ranging from 30cm to 7m. Due to the method of sampling, chip channel samples tend to be rather large (up to 20 pounds for a five foot interval)


4.2.2 High Grade Sample

The concept High Grade Sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/highgradesample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Composite sample->High Grade Sample
Definition:
in mineral exploration, selective pieces of the most highly mineralized material from a mineralize site, intentionally excluding less mineralized material. A high grade sample might be collected to indicate what the best possible values are, or to provide material for certain types of trace element analyses.


4.2.3 Site composite sample

The concept Site composite sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/sitecompositesample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Composite sample->Site composite sample
Definition:
an aggregation of peices of uniform material collected over some area (generally greater than 2.5m across). These are the ideal ‘representative’ samples used in mineral exploration. A composite sample might be collected to determine the background values of trace elements in a particular type of rock, or to determine if ore grade mineralization is present over a large area.



4.3 Core Catcher

The concept Core Catcher  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/corecatcher  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Core Catcher
Definition:
material recovered from the core catcher of a sedimentary core and which is treated as a separate section from the core. The core catcher is a device at the bottom of the core barrel that prevents the core from sliding out while the barrel is retrieved from the hole. (http://publications.iodp.org/proceedings/323/102/102_.htm)


4.4 Cuttings

The concept Cuttings  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/cuttings  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Cuttings
Definition:
unconsolidated Earth material produced by the grinding action of a drill bit during drilling of a borehole.


4.5 Dredge

The concept Dredge  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/dredge  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Dredge
Definition:
an aggregation of material sampled by dragging a collection bucket (dredge) across the bottom of a water body


4.6 Material Captured in Filter

The concept Material Captured in Filter  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/materialcapturedinfilter  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Material Captured in Filter
Definition:
A material sample captured in filter, for example from a water sample that was filtered. Must be associated with filter size field.


4.7 Mechanical fraction

The concept Mechanical fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mechanicalfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mechanical fraction
Definition:
defined by sample preparation involving mechanical processing, e.g. grain size, density, or grain shape separation.


4.8 Mineral separate

The concept Mineral separate  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mineralseparate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate
Immediately narrower concepts:
Magnetic fraction, Non-magnetic fraction
Definition:
an aggregation of particles of the same mineral extracted and concentrated from a rock.

4.8.1 Magnetic fraction

The concept Magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/magneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Magnetic fraction
Definition:
a collection of particles separated from a crushed rock sample based on their attraction to a magnet.


4.8.2 Non-magnetic fraction

The concept Non-magnetic fraction  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/nonmagneticfraction  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Analytical preparation->genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Mineral separate->Non-magnetic fraction
Definition:
collection of particles from a crushed rock sample based on their lack of attraction to a magnet



4.9 Natural aggregate specimen

The concept Natural aggregate specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/naturalaggregate  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Natural aggregate specimen
Definition:
Specimen is aggregate of non-consolidated material formed by natural processes. Particles have not been intentionally modified from the sampled feature.
Alternate labels:
Aggregate sample


4.10 Prepared powder

The concept Prepared powder  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/preparedpowder  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Prepared powder
Immediately narrower concepts:
Prepared rock powder
Definition:
distinguish from particulate in that particulate is sampled as a micron-size aggregate, whereas this material is ground to a powder for subsequent analysis; it is a powder as a function of some preparation process (e.g. chemical precipitation)
Alternate labels:
Powder

4.10.1 Prepared rock powder

The concept Prepared rock powder  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/preparedrockpowder  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Analytical preparation->Prepared powder->Prepared rock powder
Definition:
a powder manufactured by pulverizing a rock.



4.11 Trawl

The concept Trawl  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/trawl  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->Trawl
Definition:
an aggregation of biogenic or non-biogenic material extracted from a water body


4.12 TEM grod

The concept TEM grod  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/temgrid  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  genericAggregation->TEM grod
Definition:
FIB sections and microtome slices set onto a small grid for handling, transport, and analysis using a transmission electron microscope (TEM). The grid itself can be given a single sample identifier (similar to how there are multiple grains in a grain mount). The linkage from the individual samples in the grid to their parent sample(s) should be documented

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
5 Other solid Object

The concept Other solid Object  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/othersolidobject  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Dust wipe, Glass slide smear, Peel
Definition:
Single piece of material not one of the other types.

5.1 Dust wipe

The concept Dust wipe  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/dustwipe  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Other solid Object->Dust wipe
Definition:
a pre-weighed and packaged paper towel (wipe) used to wipe over a surface to collect particulates from the surface


5.2 Glass slide smear

The concept Glass slide smear  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/glassslidesmear  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Other solid Object->Analytical preparation->Glass slide smear
Definition:
sample from a cell culture (or other microparticulate suspension) spread into a thin layer on a glass slide for optical investigation


5.3 Peel

The concept Peel  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/peel  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Other solid Object->Analytical preparation->Peel
Definition:
Acetate peels are made by polishing a planar surface on a sample, etching it with acid to give it some relief, and then chemically melting a piece of acetate onto that surface. The acetate is then pulled off for examination under a microscope. The acetate preserves a fingerprint of the internal structure of the sample surface. Used in paleontology to study complex fossils, e.g. bryozoan.

title: Earth and Environmental Science extension - Material sample type
text:
6 Solid material specimen

The concept Solid material specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/solidmaterialspecimen  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/specimentypevocabulary
This is the top concept of the vocabulary.
Immediately narrower concepts:
Core, Core half round, Core peice, Core quarter round, Core section, Core subpeice, FIB lamella, Individual solid cube, Individual solid cylinder, Meteorite, Mineral specimen, Sectioned specimen, Pressed pellet, Rock hand sample, Slab, U-channel sample, Atom probe tip, Chip, Microtome slice, Mounted specimen, Particle
Definition:
Individual solid object, not formed directly by or part of a living organism, that is representative of some material.

6.1 Core

The concept Core  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/core  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core
Definition:
Cylinder of rock or sediment extracted from within the earth, and representing the entire sample extracted during a single borehole drilling event. Typically using some rotary drilling technology. In many cases the core is extracted in segments that are ‘core sections’. A core from a single borehole is rarely a continous unbroken object; commonly parts of the core will break up during drilling or extraction, leaving gaps or sections that are granular material. Cores are normally composed of consolidated (‘solid’) material, but in some cases loosely consolidated material might be recovered, and considered sediment or tephra. To be called ‘core’ the material must be sufficiently consolidated to maintain a cylindrical shape. A core hasPart (hasChild) ‘Core section’


6.2 Core half round

The concept Core half round  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/corehalfround  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core half round
Definition:
Half-cylindrical peice of consolidated material produced by along-axis split of a core whole round along a selected diameter . Has childOf relation to core section or core, core section, or Core peice from which is was split


6.3 Core peice

The concept Core peice  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/corepeice  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core peice
Definition:
A cylindrical peice of consolidated earth material extracted as a single solid object between breaks in recovery of core from a borehole. has parent core section


6.4 Core quarter round

The concept Core quarter round  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/corequarterround  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core quarter round
Definition:
a partial cylindrical peice of consolidated material created by along-axis split of a core half round. Has Parent core half round


6.5 Core section

The concept Core section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/coresection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core section
Definition:
Segment of a core representing some interval along the well bore. Child of Core


6.6 Core subpeice

The concept Core subpeice  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/coresubpeice  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Core subpeice
Definition:
A peice of consolidated material broken from a core peice. has Parent core peice or core section


6.7 FIB lamella

The concept FIB lamella  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/fiblamella  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->FIB lamella
Definition:
very thin sheet of solid material milled from a larger sample using a focused ion beam. Used for TEM analysis.


6.8 Individual solid cube

The concept Individual solid cube  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/individualsolidcube  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Individual solid cube
Definition:
A sample that is a prepared cube of material, intended as a sample of that material.


6.9 Individual solid cylinder

The concept Individual solid cylinder  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/individualsolidcylinder  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Individual solid cylinder
Definition:
A cylindrical peice of consolidated material not obtained by subsurface drilling. Cores drilled for paleomagnetic analysis are a common example. Tree ring cores are another…


6.10 Meteorite

The concept Meteorite  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/meteorite  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Meteorite
Definition:
A meteorite is a solid object that originates in interplanetary space and survives passage through an atmosphere to reach the surface of a planet or moon.


6.11 Mineral specimen

The concept Mineral specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mineralspecimen  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Mineral specimen
Definition:
a solid object consisting of one particular mineral, or several minerals intended to be representative of one or more of the mineral species.


6.12 Sectioned specimen

The concept Sectioned specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/mountedsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen
Immediately narrower concepts:
Thick section, Thin section, Ultra thin section
Definition:
a thin slice of a solid material that has been mounted on a glass slide for study

6.12.1 Thick section

The concept Thick section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/thicksection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thick section
Definition:
Thick sections are like thin sections, but milled to a greater thickness. Typcially polished on one or both sides and used for fluid or melt inclusion studies, Raman analyses, and infrared spectroscopy analyses, and SEM or electron microprobe. The standard thickness for a fluid inclusion thick section is 50 micrometers, but thick sections can be made at any thickness. Thick sections can be attached to a glass slide, or can be prepared so that they can be removed from their mount as a stand-alone slice of rock.


6.12.2 Thin section

The concept Thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/thinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thin section
Immediately narrower concepts:
Polished thin section
Definition:
thin sliver of rock cut from a sample with a diamond saw and ground optically flat, and then mounted on a glass slide and ground smooth using progressively finer abrasive grit until the sample is 30 microns thick.

6.12.2.1 Polished thin section

The concept Polished thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/polishedthinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Thin section->Polished thin section
Definition:
a thin section that has its free surface polished until perfectly planar and free of pits and scratches. Used for reflected light petrography and for electron microprobe or SEM investigation.



6.12.3 Ultra thin section

The concept Ultra thin section  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/ultrathinsection  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Sectioned specimen->Ultra thin section
Definition:
An ordinary thin section that is attached to the glass slide using a soluble cement such as Canada balsam (soluble in ethanol) to allow both sides to be worked on. The section is polished on both sides using a fine diamond paste until it has a thickness in the range of 2-12 microns. This technique has been used to study the microstructure of very fine-grained carbonate rocks, and also in the preparation of mineral and rock specimens for transmission electron microscopy.



6.13 Pressed pellet

The concept Pressed pellet  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/pressedpellet  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Pressed pellet
Definition:
a sample prepared by grinding a parent sample to a fine powder, mixing it with a binder, and pressing the mixture into a die at a pressure of between 15 and 35 tons to produce a solid disc for subsequent analysis, typically by X-Ray fluorescence.


6.14 Rock hand sample

The concept Rock hand sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/rockhandsample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Rock hand sample
Definition:
individual peice of rock broken from an outcrop or larger peice of rock.


6.15 Slab

The concept Slab  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/slab  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Analytical preparation->Slab
Definition:
a relatively planar rock sample,cut from a large sample to produce a tabular peice of rock with the irregular outline of the original sample on the diameter where the cut was mate.


6.16 U-channel sample

The concept U-channel sample  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/uchannelsample  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->U-channel sample
Definition:
a rectangular prism of loosely consolidated sediment extracted from a core segment. has parent core piece or core segment


6.17 Atom probe tip

The concept Atom probe tip  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/atomprobetip  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Atom probe tip
Definition:
needle-shaped sample milled out of a larger sample with a focused ion beam (FIB).


6.18 Chip

The concept Chip  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/chip  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Chip
Definition:
Individual solid object intentionally broken off a larger solid object sample. A Chip must have a documented parent sample.


6.19 Microtome slice

The concept Microtome slice  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/microtomeslice  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Microtome slice
Definition:
A very thin slice cut from a mounted specimen using a mocrotome or ultramicrotome.


6.20 Mounted specimen

The concept Mounted specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/mountedspecimen  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Mounted specimen
Immediately narrower concepts:
Polished mounted specimen
Definition:
one or more solid objects embedded in a stabilizing matrix, typically epoxy, metal, or paraffin to allow slicing through the mounted object(s).
Alternate labels:
Potted butt

6.20.1 Polished mounted specimen

The concept Polished mounted specimen  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/polishedmountedspecimen  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Mounted specimen->Polished mounted specimen
Definition:
Mounted specimen with polished surface exposing mounted material for analysis
Alternate labels:
Grain mount



6.21 Particle

The concept Particle  with URI https://w3id.org/isample/vocabulary/specimentype/1.0/particle  is defined in vocabulary https://w3id.org/isample/earthenv/esmaterialsample/1.0/essampletype
Path from the top concept:  Solid material specimen->Particle
Definition:
A small individual solid object that is not one of the other sample types.

title: Open Context vocabulary extension for material sample type
